author: Jillian Stampher
title: Photo: 1 person has died, another in critical condition following plane crash in Santee, Calif. - @nbcsandiego
text: 1 Dies in Santee Plane Crash Link Close Embed this video <script type="text/javascript" charset="UTF-8" src="http://www.nbcsandiego.com/portableplayer/?cmsID=324149871&videoID=7cCuKUelpz32&origin=nbcsandiego.com&sec=news&subsec=local&width=600&height=360"></script> More videos (1 of 9) « » NBC 7's Newschopper captures this video of the plane crash in Santee, just west of Gillespie Field. (Published Thursday, Sept. 3, 2015) Updated 9 minutes ago A plane crashed in the driveway of a Santee home, killing one person and sending a second passenger to the hospital in critical condition, officials confirmed. A Piper Cherokee crashed in the driveway of a home on Paseo De Los Castillos just after 9 a.m., San Diego County Sheriff's Deputies said. Cement Truck Overturns on South Bay Expressway “I heard a plane sputtering real bad,” said witness Craig Lilley. Lilley lives near the cul-de-sac where the plane crashed, south of Prospect Avenue and west of Cuyamaca Street. Images: Plane Crashes in Santee Homeowners' Driveway Lilley looked out his bedroom window and saw a plane trying to turn around toward Gillespie Field. “He was in a heavy bank and he was dropping fast. I could tell there was no way he was going to make it. The only question was if he was going to hit the houses back here or the field behind them,” Lilley said. The next thing he heard, was the crash. “You could almost time it as he was coming down. Bang,” he said. Witness: Plane 'Was Dropping Fast' ( Thu Sep 03 11:25:23 PDT 2015 Sept. ) NBC 7's Vanessa Herrera reports on the crash of a single-engine plane in the driveway of a home in Santee. (Published Thursday, Sept. 3, 2015) The aircraft struck the roof of one home and then landed on two cars. The plane finally rested upside down underneath a palm tree. One person died at the scene and one person was transported to Sharp Hospital in critical condition, deputies said. Deputies initially identified the surviving victim as the pilot but now say they are still investigating who was behind the controls. SDPD: Man Sent Explicit Material to 'Dance Mom' Star No one on the ground was injured. FAA spokesperson Ian Gregor said the plane crashed under unknown circumstances around 9:15 a.m. approximately one mile from Gillespie Field. He said the FAA and the NTSB will investigate. 'It's All Gone': Couple Hopes to Find Missing Baby Pictures The plane is registered to Volar Corp. which runs the Golden State Flying Club. A member wouldn’t confirm who was on the aircraft until officials release the names out of respect for the families. San Diego Explained: Lilac Hills Ranch Housing Project However, he did say the club has not had an accident since it opened in 1968. NBC 7's Meteorologist Jodi Kodesh said there were no unusual wind conditions in the area at the time of the crash.
